section.title: What computer hardware do you recommend for running Dialog Nibelung?
section.p: Absolute minimum hardware requirements for the teacher workstation are listed in section _fixme_ xref of this manual.

Student workstations have lower requirements. Essentially any modern desktop, notebook, or ultrabook with at least 512 MB of RAM will do the job. A more powerful computer may increase software responsiveness and/or quality of the video playback.

section.title: What headsets can you recommend?
section.p: We recommend heavy duty circumaural (over-ear) headsets with directional boom microphones. VoIP and/or call center headsets from recognized manufacturers (e.g. Plantronics) also work quite well in a language lab settings.

section.title: What network equipment can you recommend?
section.p: Performance of a software based language lab greatly depends on both bandwidth and latency of the classroom LAN, particularly if the audio hub is not used. As a rule of thumb, we recommend using business grade equipment for both wired and wireless networks. Consumer grade equipment should be avoided.

section.title: What hardware is necessary for using an external video source as a media source?
section.p: The teacher workstation has to be equipped with a video capture interface, either analog or digital, depending on the type of the video source.

section.title: What operating systems does Dialog Nibelung support?
section.p: Dialog Nibelung can run on any operating system where Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5 can be installed. For a complete list of supported operating systems, please see section _fixme_ xref.
